intro: Psychotria expansa, commonly known as the "Coca plant" or "Yareta," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru, where it thrives in high-altitude environments. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, white or pale green flowers. It is often found growing in rocky or alpine habitats, where it forms mats or low shrubs. Psychotria expansa is notable for its ecological importance and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
